metadata.prompt_text:
ITERATION 2 - REFINEMENT NEEDED

Your previous attempt had quality issues (Score: 77.5/100).

PROBLEMS IDENTIFIED:
  - Agent 1 has short path (1.55m), consider increasing to ≥3m for more interesting navigation
  - Agent 0 CANNOT reach its goal - no valid path exists even with obstacle avoidance!
  - Agent 3 CANNOT reach its goal - no valid path exists even with obstacle avoidance!

COMPONENT SCORES:
  - Agent Placement: 95.0/100
  - Obstacle Quality: 100.0/100
  - Reachability: 40.0/100
  - Spatial Distribution: 85.0/100

CRITICAL FIXES NEEDED:

  1. REACHABILITY ISSUES - MOST CRITICAL:
     - Some agents CANNOT reach their goals
     - Check that all rooms/areas are connected with doorways
     - Doorways must be at least 1.0m wide
     - Verify walls don't completely block paths
     - Each agent needs a continuous path from start to goal
     - Don't place goals behind walls with no openings


ORIGINAL REQUEST:
Create an office suite with 3 connected rooms:
- Room 1 (lobby): x=[0,5], y=[0,5], door on right wall at y=2.5, width 1.2m
- Room 2 (hallway): x=[5,12], y=[0,5], connects rooms 1 and 3
- Room 3 (conference): x=[5,12], y=[5,10], door on bottom wall at x=8.5, width 1.5m
- Walls fully enclose each room except for doorways
Robot starts in room 1 at (2,2), goal in room 3 at (8,7)
Human 1 in room 3 at (9,7), going to room 1 at (2,3)
Human 2 in hallway at (8,2), going to room 3 at (10,7)
Human 3 in room 1 at (3,4), goal in hallway at (9,2)
This creates doorway congestion and multi-room navigation

NOW REGENERATE THE SCENARIO:
- Fix ALL the problems listed above
- Pay special attention to reachability - ensure EVERY agent can reach their goal
- If creating rooms, explicitly define doorway openings with precise coordinates
- Double-check that wall segments connect properly
- Verify agent positions are in valid free space

Generate the corrected JSON now.
